<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>EXHIBIT&nbsp;10.11(a)</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>DELTA AIR LINES, INC.</B><BR>
<U><B>OFFICER AND DIRECTOR SEVERANCE PLAN</B></U><BR>
<B>As Amended and Restated as of January&nbsp;2, 2009<BR>
As Further Amended October&nbsp;20, 2009</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>1. </B><U><B>INTRODUCTION</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Delta Air Lines, Inc. (the &#147;<B>Company</B>&#148; or &#147;<B>Delta</B>&#148;) adopted the 2007 Officer and Director Severance
Plan (the &#147;<B>Prior Plan</B>&#148;) for eligible Officer and Director level employees of the Company. Delta
hereby amends and restates the Prior Plan as the 2009 Delta Air Lines, Inc. Officer and Director
Severance Plan (the &#147;<B>2009 Plan</B>&#148;) effective as of January&nbsp;2, 2009. The Plan has been further
amended as of October&nbsp;20, 2009. Participants in the Prior Plan whose employment terminates on or
prior to January&nbsp;2, 2009 shall not be eligible for benefits under the 2009 Plan, but shall only be
eligible for benefits under the Prior Plan, subject to any other separately granted contractual
rights they may have. Except as provided in the previous sentence and as provided below with
respect to certain Officers and Directors who were actively employed by Delta as of October&nbsp;28,
2008, the terms of the Prior Plan shall no longer be in effect as of January&nbsp;2, 2009.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Capitalized terms that are not otherwise defined in the text of this 2009 Plan are defined in
Section&nbsp;11 below.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>2. </B><U><B>PARTICIPATION</B></U>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(a) <U>General</U>. Any employee of the Company who on or after January&nbsp;2, 2009 is paid
through the U.S. payroll and is classified as a full-time Director (a &#147;<B>Director</B>&#148;) or
Officer (an &#147;<B>Officer</B>&#148;) of the Company according to the Company&#146;s Human Resources records (a
&#147;<B>Participant</B>&#148;) is eligible to participate in this Plan in accordance with the terms
described below. In addition, an officer or director of an Affiliate may be designated as
a Participant by the Plan Administrator in his sole discretion if (i)&nbsp;the Affiliate does
not offer a severance plan or program to its executive employees; or (ii)&nbsp;the officer or
director is not eligible to participate in the severance plan or program the Affiliate does
offer. In these circumstances, the Plan Administrator shall determine in his sole
discretion the level at which the officer or director may participate in the 2009 Plan.
For example, an employee of an Affiliate may be a Vice President of an Affiliate, but may
be designated by the Plan Administrator to participate in the 2009 Plan at the Director
level.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(b) <U>Former Northwest Officers and Directors</U>. Notwithstanding anything in the 2009
Plan to the contrary, any Officer or Director who (i)&nbsp;on October&nbsp;28, 2008 was either (A)&nbsp;an
officer of Northwest Airlines, Inc. or (B)&nbsp;a managing director, director or other employee
of Northwest Airlines, Inc. who participated in the Northwest Airlines, Inc. Non-Officer
Change of Control Severance Plan, and (ii)&nbsp;became an Officer or Director of Delta on or
after October&nbsp;29, 2008, shall not participate in the 2009 Plan until October&nbsp;29, 2010
unless such person was a Senior Vice President or higher of Delta on October&nbsp;29, 2008, in
which case such person shall not participate in the 2009 Plan until October&nbsp;29, 2011.
After such dates, any such Officer or Director shall be eligible for all benefits
hereunder.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(c) <U>Pre Merger Officer or Director and Prior Plan Benefits</U>. An Officer or
Director employed by Delta as an officer or director on October&nbsp;28, 2008 who was not
advised by
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->&nbsp;<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Delta that his or her employment would be terminated on or before January&nbsp;1,
2009 (a &#147;Pre Merger Officer or Director&#148;) shall be eligible to receive benefits under the
Prior Plan until October&nbsp;29, 2010. During such time, a Pre Merger Officer or Director
shall also be eligible for benefits under the 2009 Plan, but will not be eligible for
duplicate benefits under both plans. After October&nbsp;29, 2010, any Pre Merger Officer or
Director who remains employed by Delta (or any Affiliate) as an Officer or Director shall
be eligible for benefits under the 2009 Plan, but not the Prior Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>3. TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT AND ELIGIBILITY</B>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(a) <U>Severance Event</U>. Subject to Section&nbsp;2, a Participant shall be eligible to
receive the benefits described in Section&nbsp;4 if after January&nbsp;2, 2009 he incurs a &#147;<B>Severance
Event</B>&#148; which shall be defined as any of the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(i)&nbsp;the Participant&#146;s employment is terminated by Delta other than for Cause<I>. </I>If
a Participant who is eligible for early, special early or normal retirement under
the Company&#146;s retirement plan or policy is, or would be, terminated by the Company
without Cause, such Participant shall be considered to have been terminated by the
Company without Cause for purposes of the 2009 Plan rather than having retired,
but only if the Participant acknowledges that, absent retirement, the Participant
would have been terminated by the Company without Cause. If, however, the
employment of a Participant who is eligible for retirement is terminated by the
Company for Cause, then regardless of whether the Participant is considered as a
retiree for purposes of any other program, plan or policy of the Company, for
purposes of the 2009 Plan, the Participant&#146;s employment shall be considered to
have been terminated by the Company for Cause;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(ii)&nbsp;the Participant (other than the Chief Executive Officer and the President of
the Company as of October&nbsp;29, 2008) (A)&nbsp;resigns from employment with Delta for
Good Reason during the period beginning on a Change in Control Date and ending on
the second anniversary thereof (provided that the event that constitutes Good
Reason must occur after the Change in Control) and (B)&nbsp;was employed by Delta as of
the Change in Control Date; or
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(iii)&nbsp;with respect to either the Chief Executive Officer or the President of the
Company as of October&nbsp;29, 2008, the Participant resigns for Good Reason.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(b) <U>Condition Precedent to Receipt of Any Benefits Under the Plan</U>. In order to
receive the benefits of the 2009 Plan, eligible Participants must first sign a Separation
Agreement and General Release prepared by Delta (the &#147;<B>Agreement</B>&#148;) within 45&nbsp;days of the
date that the Agreement is presented to the Participant. Participants who fail to sign the
Agreement within 45&nbsp;days or who rescind the Agreement within the applicable Revocation
Period are not eligible to receive benefits under the 2009 Plan. The Agreement is designed
to ensure that both Delta and the Participant have their rights and obligations in
connection with the termination of employment established with certainty and finality.
Delta is offering benefits under this 2009 Plan in exchange for the execution of the Agreement. The Agreement shall be in a form provided by and satisfactory
to Delta and may include, without limitation, a release in favor of Delta and its
employees, directors and Affiliates and certain non-competition, non-solicitation and
non-recruitment
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->2<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">agreements for the benefit of Delta; <U><I>provided</I></U><I>, </I><U><I>however</I></U>,
that for the two year period following a Change in Control, the Agreement shall be in
substantially the same form as the form of Agreement used immediately prior to the Change
in Control.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>4. </B><U><B>DESCRIPTION OF SPECIFIC BENEFITS</B></U>
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Upon a Severance Event, each Participant will be eligible for the following benefits:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(a) <U>Severance Pay</U>. A Participant will be eligible for &#147;<B>Severance Pay</B>&#148;, in an
amount determined as described below, and based on the Participant&#146;s job level at the time
of the Severance Event. If however, the Severance Event is described in Section&nbsp;3(a)(ii)
or (iii)&nbsp;above and the event which constitutes Good Reason is a significant diminution of
the Participant&#146;s position, responsibilities or duties, Severance Pay shall be based on the
Participant&#146;s MIP Target Award prior to the diminution which gave rise to the Participant&#146;s
resignation. Severance Pay will be paid as a one-time lump-sum payment promptly following
the Participant&#146;s Severance Event (taking into account however, sufficient time to perform
the calculations, if any, necessary under Section 4(e) and fulfillment of the other
eligibility criteria including compliance with Section 3(b) above, but in no event shall be
paid more than two and one half months following the end of the year in which the Severance
Event occurs. All applicable federal, state, and local taxes will be withheld from all
Severance Pay. Severance Pay will not be considered as earnings under any qualified or non
qualified plan or program sponsored by Delta or any Affiliate. Each Participant will be
eligible for Severance Pay in an amount equal to:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(i)&nbsp;6&nbsp;months Base Salary for Directors, plus 50% of any applicable MIP Target
Amount;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(ii)&nbsp;9&nbsp;months Base Salary for Managing Directors, plus 75% of any applicable MIP
Target Amount;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(iii)&nbsp;12&nbsp;months Base Salary for Vice Presidents, plus 100% of any applicable MIP
Target Amount;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(iv)&nbsp;15&nbsp;months Base Salary for Senior Vice Presidents, plus 125% of any applicable
MIP Target Amount;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(v)&nbsp;18&nbsp;months Base Salary for Executive Vice Presidents, plus 150% of any
applicable MIP Target Amount ; and
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(vi)&nbsp;24&nbsp;months Base Salary for the President or Chief Executive Officer, plus 200%
of any applicable MIP Target Amount.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(b) <U>Extension of Benefits During Severance Period</U>. A Participant shall be eligible
for the following extended benefits for the periods noted below.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(i) <U>Medical/Dental and Life Insurance Benefits.</U>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(A)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Payment of COBRA Premiums</U>. Delta
will pay the premiums for medical, dental and/or vision COBRA
coverage (but not for any portion of the COBRA premium for any
Healthcare Flexible</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->3<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt"><TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">


<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Spending Account) for which a Participant and his
eligible dependents may be eligible, provided such COBRA coverage is
properly elected by the Participant or his eligible dependents.
Eligibility for such payments shall continue until the earlier of:
(i)&nbsp;the end of the Severance Period; or (ii)&nbsp;the date the
Participant&#146;s or the Participant&#146;s dependents&#146; eligibility for COBRA
coverage ceases as provided under COBRA and the terms of the Delta
Account-Based Healthcare Plan (or corresponding pilot or Affiliate
plan, if applicable).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="6%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(B)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><U>Payment of Retiree Medical
Premiums.</U> To the extent applicable, if a Participant is eligible
for special early, early or normal retirement under the Company&#146;s
retirement plan or policy at the time of the Severance Event, and the
Participant or one or more of his eligible dependents elects COBRA
coverage instead of retiree medical and/or dental coverage, the above
section entitled &#147;Payment of COBRA Premiums&#148; will apply with respect
to any Delta-paid COBRA premium. If the Participant or an eligible
dependent instead elects retiree medical and/or dental coverage,
Delta will, in lieu of paying COBRA premiums as described above, pay
the retiree medical and/or dental premium for the Participant and/or
his eligible dependents during the Severance Period, provided that
the Participant and/or his eligible dependents properly enroll for
such coverage. If a Participant or his dependents become ineligible
for Delta retiree coverage for any reason or opt out of such
coverage, all Delta paid coverage for that person (or group of
persons) will cease and Delta will have no responsibility to pay any
further retiree medical and/or dental premiums under the 2009 Plan;
however the Participant or his dependents shall retain whatever
rights they may have under any other applicable Delta sponsored
retiree medical plan or program.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(ii) <U>Basic Life Insurance</U>. Participants will also have their basic life
insurance coverage under the Delta Family-Care Disability and Survivorship Plan (or
corresponding pilot or Affiliate plan, if applicable) continued for the Severance
Period at Delta&#146;s expense; provided the Participant shall be responsible for any
taxes associated with such continuation. The amount of coverage continued will be
equal to the amount of basic life insurance coverage in effect immediately prior to
separation. This continued coverage shall not affect any other death benefit for
which the Participant is eligible.
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->4<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(iii) <U>Travel Privileges.</U>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A) During the Severance Period, a Participant will be eligible for continued
travel privileges generally comparable to those under Delta&#146;s travel policy as in
effect for an active employee at the Participant&#146;s job level at the time of the
Severance Event. If however, the Severance Event is described in Section&nbsp;3(a)(ii)
or (iii)&nbsp;above and the event which constitutes Good Reason is a significant
diminution of the Participant&#146;s position, responsibilities or duties, any Travel
Privileges shall be based on the Participant&#146;s job level prior to the diminution
which gave rise to the Participant&#146;s resignation. In addition, with respect to any
Participant who (i)&nbsp;incurs a termination that constitutes a Severance Event during
the period beginning on a Change in Control Date and ending on the second
anniversary thereof and (ii)&nbsp;is a Vice President or more senior Officer of the
Company at the time of the Change in Control Date, such Participant shall after the
expiration of the Travel Privileges described in the previous sentence, be treated
as a retired officer for purposes of the Company&#146;s travel policy regardless of the
Participant&#146;s actual age or years of service. Following the expiration of the
Severance Period, the Participant&#146;s travel benefits will be based on the Company
travel policy for retired officers at the level at which the Participant was
employed immediately prior to the Change in Control Date. Provided however,
anything in the 2009 Plan to the contrary notwithstanding, any person who first
becomes an Officer or Director after June&nbsp;8, 2009 shall not receive any Tax
Allowance (as that term is defined in the Delta Air Lines, Inc. UATP Travel
Program) during the Severance Period or following his or her termination of active
employment.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B) All Travel Privileges shall be governed by all applicable rules and
procedures which are generally applicable at the time the Travel Privileges are
used, except as expressly modified in this 2009 Plan. Travel Privileges may be
used for pleasure, vacation, or personal emergency, but may not be used for any
type of business or professional activity. Any violation of the rules governing
non-revenue and reduced rate travel may result in the suspension or termination of
all Travel Privileges for the Participant and/or his family members (or friends and
family travelers).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(C) Family status changes (such as marriage, divorce, adoption or birth of
child) that occur during the Severance Period must be reported to the Delta
Employee Service Center (or corresponding Affiliate administrator) within 30&nbsp;days
of the status change. Failure to do so will result in the ineligibility of the new
family member for Travel Privileges described under this 2009 Plan.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(D) This section shall not create any contractual rights, and the Travel
Privileges provided pursuant to this provision shall remain subject to Delta&#146;s
right to apply all applicable rules as they exist from time to time and to modify
or terminate such privileges at any time, including after termination of
employment, in its sole discretion.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(E) If a Participant has contractual rights to travel privileges that are
provided in another agreement that are different or not as favorable as the Travel
Privileges provided under this section, such Participant shall also be eligible for
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->5<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">the Travel Privileges granted hereunder, but shall have no contractual rights to
such different or more favorable Travel Privileges. In that case, the reservation
of rights in (D)&nbsp;above shall apply only to the Travel Privileges that are provided
under this section, and not to any other contractual travel privileges the
Participant may have. A Participant that has separately granted contractual rights
may use his contractually granted rights or the Travel Privileges granted under the
2009 Plan, but not both. For example, if under both the 2009 Plan and any
contractual agreement, the Participant is eligible under each for an allowance of
$10,000, the Participant may use one such allowance of $10,000, and the two
allowances cannot be combined into a total allowance of $20,000.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(c) <U>Career Transition Services.</U> Participants are eligible to receive career
transition services valued at up to $5,000 at a career transition services firm chosen by
Delta. Delta shall pay such firm directly for such services. The career transition
services may include seminars, job search work teams, productivity clinic, resum&#233;
preparation, assessments, resource library, on-line database, job lead development,
individual counseling, administrative support, computer lab, and workspace phone/fax. The
eligibility to receive these services will expire upon the first of (x)&nbsp;the Participant
becoming employed; (y)&nbsp;the expiration of the Severance Period; or (z)&nbsp;the last day of the
second year following the taxable year in which the Participant separated from service for
purposes of Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code, as amended (the &#147;Code&#148;)..
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(d) <U>Financial Planning Services.</U> Participants are eligible for continuation of the
financial planning services for which they are eligible at the time of their separation
from Delta. A Participant shall be reimbursed for any covered expenses; Delta shall not
provide direct payments to the vendor for such services. The eligibility to receive such
reimbursement will expire at the conclusion of the calendar year in which the Participant
separates from Delta, even if that occurs during the Severance Period. All reimbursements
for such services must be made by the end of the third year following the taxable year in
which the Participant separated from service for purposes of Section&nbsp;409A of the Code.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(e) <U>Certain Reductions in Payments</U>.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(i) In the event that a Participant becomes entitled to benefits under the 2009 Plan,
and Delta, or at its direction, the Accounting Firm (as defined below), determines that the
payments and benefits provided under the 2009 Plan, together with any payment or
consideration in the nature of value or compensation to or for Participant&#146;s benefit under
any other agreement with, or plan of, Delta that the Accounting Firm determines should be
included as a parachute payment (as defined in Section&nbsp;280G of the Code) (in the aggregate,
&#147;Total Payments&#148;) would (after taking into account any value attributable to any payment
(or portion thereof) which Delta establishes by clear and convincing evidence is reasonable
compensation for personal services to be rendered by the Participant on or after the date
of the change in ownership or control within the meaning of Section&nbsp;280g(b)(4)(A) of the
Code, such payment hereinafter referred to as &#147;post change reasonable compensation&#148;),
subject Participant to the excise tax under Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code, the Accounting Firm
shall determine whether to reduce the Total Payments to the Reduced Amount (as defined
below). The Total Payments shall be reduced to the Reduced Amount only if the Accounting Firm
determines that Participant would have a greater Net After-Tax Receipt (as defined
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->6<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">below) of aggregate Payments if Participant&#146;s Total Payments were reduced to the Reduced Amount.
If instead the Accounting Firm determines that Participant would not have a greater Net
After-Tax Receipt of aggregate payments if Participant&#146;s Total Payments were reduced to the
Reduced Amount, Participant shall receive all Total Payments to which Participant is
entitled. Any valuation of any post change reasonable compensation shall be determined by
the Accounting Firm (or, if the Accounting Firm is not able to make such determination, an
independent third-party valuation specialist, selected by Delta), and Delta shall cooperate
in good faith in connection with any such valuation process.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(ii) If the Accounting Firm determines that aggregate Total Payments should be reduced
to the Reduced Amount, Delta shall promptly give Participant notice to that effect and a
copy of the detailed calculation thereof. All determinations made by the Accounting Firm
(or, with respect to the valuation of the post change reasonable compensation, or to the
extent applicable, the independent third-party valuation specialist) under this section
shall be binding upon Delta and Participant and shall be made within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after
a termination of Participant&#146;s employment. The reduction of the Total Payments to the
Reduced Amount, if applicable, shall be made by reducing the Total Payments under the
following types of compensation or value in the following order: (i)&nbsp;Stock Options, (ii)
Restricted Stock, (iii)&nbsp;Performance Shares, and (iv)&nbsp;Cash. All fees and expenses of the
Accounting Firm and the independent third-party valuation specialist (if any) shall be
borne solely by Delta.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iii) As a result of the uncertainty in the application of Sections&nbsp;280G and 4999 of
the Code at the time of the initial determination by the Accounting Firm hereunder, it is
possible that amounts will have been paid or distributed by Delta to or for the benefit of
Participant pursuant to the 2009 Plan which should not have been so paid or distributed
(&#147;Overpayment&#148;) or that additional amounts which will have not been paid or distributed by
Delta to or for the benefit of Participant pursuant to the 2009 Plan could have been so
paid or distributed (&#147;Underpayment&#148;), in each case, consistent with the calculation of the
Reduced Amount hereunder. In the event that the Accounting Firm, based upon the assertion
of a deficiency by the Internal Revenue Service against either Delta or Participant which
the Accounting Firm believes has a high probability of success determines that an
Overpayment has been made, Participant shall pay any such Overpayment to Delta together
with at the applicable federal rate provided for in Section&nbsp;7872(f)(2) of the Code;
provided, however, that no amount shall be payable by Participant to Delta if and to the
extent such payment would not either reduce the amount on which Participant is subject to
tax under Sections&nbsp;1, 3101 and 4999 of the Code or generate a refund of such taxes. In the
event that the Accounting Firm, based upon controlling precedent or substantial authority,
determines that an Underpayment has occurred, any such Underpayment shall be promptly paid
by Delta to or for the benefit of Participant together with interest at the applicable
federal rate provided for in Section&nbsp;7872(f)(2) of the Code. In all events, any
Overpayment or Underpayment shall be paid no later than December&nbsp;31 of the year after the
year in which the Overpayment or Underpayment is determined to exist.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(iv) For purposes hereof, the following terms have the meanings set forth below:
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->7<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A) &#147;Net After-Tax Receipt&#148; shall mean the present value (as determined in accordance
with Sections&nbsp;280G(b)(2)(A)(ii) and 280G(d)(4) of the Code) of a payment net of all taxes
imposed on Participant with respect thereto under Sections&nbsp;1, 3101 and 4999 of the Code and
under applicable state and local laws, determined by applying the highest marginal rate
under Section&nbsp;1 of the Code and under state and local laws which applied to Participant&#146;s
taxable income for the immediately preceding taxable year, or such other rate(s) as
Participant certifies, in his or her sole discretion, as likely to apply to him or her in
the relevant tax year(s), and 1.45% under Section&nbsp;3101. If applicable, the phase out of
itemized deductions and personal exemptions shall also be taken into consideration.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B) &#147;Reduced Amount&#148; shall mean the greatest amount of Total Payments that can be paid
that would not result in the imposition of the excise tax under Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code if
the Accounting Firm determines to reduce Total Payments pursuant this Section.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(C) &#147;Accounting Firm&#148; shall mean the nationally recognized accounting firm generally
used by Delta as its financial auditor. In the event that the Accounting Firm is serving
as accountant or auditor for a person effecting the Change in Control or is otherwise
unavailable, the Participant may appoint another nationally recognized accounting firm to
make the determinations required hereunder (which accounting firm shall then be referred to
as the Accounting Firm hereunder).
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(f) <U>Severance Period</U>. &#147;<B>Severance Period</B>&#148; shall mean with respect to any Severance
Event, the period beginning on the Participant&#146;s employment termination date from Delta and
ending:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>6&nbsp;months after the termination date for Directors;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>9&nbsp;months after the termination date for Managing Directors;</TD>

    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>

Chief Executive Officer.</TD>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">The Severance Period will be based on the Participant&#146;s job level at the time of the
Severance Event. If however, the Severance Event is described in Section&nbsp;3(a)(ii) or (iii)
above and the event which constitutes Good Reason is a significant diminution of the
Participant&#146;s position, responsibilities or duties, the Severance Period shall be based on
the Participant&#146;s job level prior to the diminution which gave rise to the Participant&#146;s resignation
</DIV>




<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->8<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>5. </B><U><B>PLAN ADMINISTRATION AND INTERPRETATION</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The &#147;<B>Plan Administrator</B>&#148; is the Executive Vice President &#151; Human Resources &#038; Labor Relations (or
any other Officer of the Company designated by the Personnel &#038; Compensation Committee of the
Board). The &#147;<B>Plan Year</B>&#148; is January 1 to December&nbsp;31. Benefits from the 2009 Plan are paid from
the general assets of Delta.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Plan Administrator, or his delegate, has the full power and authority, in his sole discretion
to construe, interpret and administer the 2009 Plan and his decisions shall be final and binding.
The Plan Administrator shall have the broadest discretionary authority permitted under law in the
exercise of all its functions including, but not limited to, deciding questions of eligibility,
interpretation and the right to benefits hereunder.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>6. </B><U><B>PLAN CLAIMS AND APPEALS </B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Any Participant who upon the termination of his employment does not receive the benefits under the
2009 Plan to which he believes he is entitled may file a claim for such benefits in writing to the
Vice President &#151; Compensation, Benefits and Services of the Company (or such other officer as may
be designated by the Company). Such claim must be received by the Vice President &#151; Compensation,
Benefits and Services within 60&nbsp;days of the Participant&#146;s termination of employment. If the claim
is denied, the Vice President &#151; Compensation, Benefits and Services will send written notification
of the denial within 90&nbsp;days after the claim is properly and completely filed. Special
circumstances may require an additional period of no more than 90&nbsp;days. In that event, the
Participant will be sent a written notice of the special circumstances requiring the extension and
the date when a decision on the claim can be expected. If the claim is denied, the Participant
will be so advised and informed of the reason, the provisions of the 2009 Plan upon which the
denial was based, and, if applicable, an explanation of other relevant material or information
necessary to perfect the claim. If the claim is denied or if the Participant is not furnished with
written notification of the decision on the claim within 90&nbsp;days (or within 180&nbsp;days if an
extension is necessary) after the claim is properly and completely filed, the Participant or his
authorized representative may request a review of the claim under the appeal procedures described
below.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If a Participant is dissatisfied with a denial of a claim under the 2009 Plan, the Participant must
appeal the denial in writing before pursuing any other remedy. All appeals must be addressed to
the proper party in a timely manner. <B>All appeal time deadlines will be strictly enforced.</B>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">If a Participant desires a review of a denial, the Participant or his representative designated in
writing must submit a written request to the Plan Administrator that is received by the Plan
Administrator within 90&nbsp;days of the date of the letter denying benefits. The date of the denial
indicated on the denial letter counts as day one in determining this 90-day period and the Plan
Administrator expressly reserves the right to refuse to consider tardy appeals.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Plan Administrator will notify the Participant or his designated representative in writing of
the decision on review within 60&nbsp;days after the Plan Administrator receives the review request. If
the claim denial is upheld, the Participant will be so advised and informed of the reason and the
provisions of the 2009 Plan document upon which the denial was based. The Plan Administrator may take an additional 60&nbsp;days to inform the Participant of a decision if special
circumstances require an extension of processing time and the Plan Administrator has notified the
Participant in writing that there will be a delay, the reasons for needing more time, and the date
by which the final decision will be made.
</DIV>



<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->9<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Review by the Plan Administrator is made only upon the written record. The Participant or his
representative designated in writing may review pertinent documents relating to the denial and may
submit comments, a statement of issues, and/or additional documentary evidence if desired.
Personal appearances are not permitted.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">A Participant must timely exhaust the administrative remedies allowed under the 2009 Plan as
described above before filing any legal action on a claim. The previously described procedure is
the exclusive administrative claims procedure provided under the 2009 Plan.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>7. </B><U><B>AMENDMENT</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Except as expressly set forth herein, the Company may amend or terminate the 2009 Plan at any time;
<U><I>provided</I></U><I>, </I><U><I>however</I></U>, that as of a Change in Control Date, no amendment to or
termination of the 2009 Plan that is adverse to any person who is an employee of Delta on the
Change in Control Date shall be effective until after the second anniversary of such Change in
Control Date.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>8. </B><U><B>SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The 2009 Plan shall be binding upon Delta&#146;s successors and assigns.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>9. </B><U><B>GOVERNING LAW</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The 2009 Plan is governed by the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended
(&#147;<B>ERISA</B>&#148;), but it is intended to qualify as a plan maintained for the purpose of providing benefits
to a select group of management or highly compensated employees. As such, it is exempt from
certain provisions of ERISA pursuant to ERISA Sections&nbsp;201(2), 301(a)(3), 401(a)(1) and 4021(b) and
applicable regulations (including U.S. Department of Labor Regulation&nbsp;2520.104-23). However, some
of the underlying benefits provided for under the terms of the 2009 Plan, such as travel
privileges, financial planning and career transition services are not governed by ERISA, and their
inclusion in the 2009 Plan does not deem them subject to ERISA. To the extent not superseded by
ERISA, the 2009 Plan and all determinations made and actions taken thereunder shall be governed by
the internal substantive laws of the State of Georgia and construed accordingly.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>10. </B><U><B>SECTION 409A OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">To the extent required to be in compliance with Section&nbsp;409A of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986,
as amended, and the regulations promulgated thereunder (together, &#147;<B>Section&nbsp;409A</B>&#148;), notwithstanding
any other provision of this Plan, (a)&nbsp;any payment or benefit to which a Participant is eligible
under this Plan, including a Participant who is a &#147;specified employee&#148; as defined in Section&nbsp;409A,
shall be adjusted or delayed and (b)&nbsp;any term of the Plan may be adjusted, in such manner as to
comply with Section&nbsp;409A and maintain the intent of this Plan to the maximum extent possible. More
specifically, to the extent any payment or benefit provided to a Participant under the 2009 Plan
constitutes non excepted deferred compensation under Section&nbsp;409A and the Participant is at the time of his termination of employment considered to be a
&#147;specified employee&#148; pursuant to the Company&#146;s policy for determining such employees, the payment
of any such non excepted amount and the provision of such non excepted benefits will be delayed for
six months following the Participant&#146;s separation from service. Notwithstanding the foregoing,
Delta shall not have any liability to any Participant or any other person if any payment or benefit
is determined to constitute &#147;nonqualified deferred compensation&#148; within the
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->10<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">meaning of Section&nbsp;409A and does not satisfy the additional conditions applicable to nonqualified deferred compensation
under Section&nbsp;409A.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt"><B>11. </B><U><B>DEFINITIONS</B></U>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The following definitions shall apply for purposes of the 2009 Plan:
</DIV>



<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(a) &#147;<B>Affiliate</B>&#148; means any entity that directly or indirectly controls or is controlled by
or under common control with the Company.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(b) &#147;<B>Base Salary</B>&#148; means the Participant&#146;s monthly base salary at the time of separation,
excluding expense reimbursements and supplemental salary payments, and any items not
considered by the Plan Administrator to be a component of regular monthly base earnings;
<U><I>provided</I></U><I>, </I><U><I>however</I></U>, that, as of a Change in Control Date, in the event of a
termination of employment by the Participant because of a reduction in the Participant&#146;s
pay, &#147;Base Salary&#148; means the Participant&#146;s monthly base salary prior to the reduction in
pay which gave rise to the Participant&#146;s termination of employment.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(c) &#147;<B>Board</B>&#148; means the Board of Directors of the Company.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(d) &#147;<B>Cause</B>&#148; means the Participant&#146;s
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(i)&nbsp;continued, substantial failure to perform his duties with Delta (other than any
such failure resulting from incapacity due to physical or mental illness) after a
written demand for substantial performance is delivered to the Participant which
identifies the manner in which Delta believes that the Participant has not
performed his duties, or
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(ii)&nbsp;misconduct which is economically injurious to Delta, or
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(iii)&nbsp;conviction of, or plea of guilty or no contest to, a felony or any other
crime involving moral turpitude, fraud, theft, embezzlement or dishonesty, or
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(iv)&nbsp;material violation of any material Delta policy or rule regarding conduct,
which policy or rule has been communicated in writing to the Participant.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">A Participant shall have at least ten (10)&nbsp;business days to cure, if curable, any of the
events (other than Section&nbsp;11(d)(iii)) which could lead to his termination of Cause. For
any Participant who is an Executive Vice President or more senior executive of the Company,
a termination for Cause must be approved by a 2/3 vote of the entire Board.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(e) &#147;<B>Change in Control</B>&#148; means the occurrence after January&nbsp;2, 2009 of any of the following:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(i)&nbsp;any &#147;person&#148; (as defined in Section 13(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of
1934 (&#147;<B>Act</B>&#148;)) other than the Company, its Affiliates or an employee benefit plan or
trust maintained by the Company or its Affiliates, becoming the &#147;beneficial owner&#148;
(as defined in Rule&nbsp;13d-3 under the Act), directly or indirectly, of more than 35%
of the combined voting power of the Company&#146;s then outstanding Voting Stock
(excluding any &#147;person&#148; who becomes such a
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->11<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">beneficial owner in connection with a transaction described in Section&nbsp;11(e)(iii)(A) of paragraph (iii)&nbsp;below), unless
such person acquires beneficial ownership of more than 35% of the combined voting
power of the Company&#146;s Voting Stock then outstanding solely as a result of an
acquisition of Company Voting Stock by the Company which, by reducing the Company
Voting Stock outstanding, increases the proportionate Company Voting Stock
beneficially owned by such person to more than 35% of the combined voting power of
the Company&#146;s Voting Stock then outstanding; <U><I>provided</I></U>, that if a person
shall become the beneficial owner of more than 35% of the combined voting power of
the Company&#146;s Voting Stock then outstanding by reason of such Voting Stock
acquisition by the Company and shall thereafter become the beneficial owner of any
additional Company Voting Stock which causes the proportionate voting power of such
Company Voting Stock beneficially owned by such person to increase to more than 35%
of the combined voting power of such Voting Stock then outstanding, such person
shall, upon becoming the beneficial owner of such additional Company Voting Stock,
be deemed to have become the beneficial owner of more than 35% of the combined
voting power of the Company&#146;s Voting Stock then outstanding other than solely as a
result of such Voting Stock acquisition by the Company;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(ii)&nbsp;at any time during a period of twelve consecutive months (but not including
any period before January&nbsp;2, 2009) individuals who at the beginning of such period
constituted the Board (and any new member of the Board, whose election by the Board
or nomination for election by the Company&#146;s shareowners was approved by a vote of
at least two-thirds of the members of the Board then still in office who either
were member of the Board at the beginning of the period or whose election or
nomination for election was so approved), cease for any reason to constitute a
majority of members then constituting the Board; or
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(iii)&nbsp;the consummation of (A)&nbsp;a reorganization, merger or consolidation of the
Company or any direct or indirect subsidiary of the Company with any other
corporation, other than a reorganization, merger or consolidation which results in
the Company&#146;s Voting Stock outstanding immediately prior to such merger or
consolidation continuing to represent (either by remaining outstanding or being
converted into Voting Stock of the surviving entity or any parent thereof) more
than 65% of the voting power of the Voting Stock or the total fair market value of
the securities of the Company or such surviving entity or any parent thereof
outstanding immediately after such merger or consolidation, or (B)&nbsp;any sale, lease,
exchange or other transfer (in one transaction or a series of transactions) of
assets of the Company having a total gross fair market value equal to more than 40%
of the total gross fair market value of all assets of the Company immediately prior to such transaction or transactions other than any such sale to
an Affiliate.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Notwithstanding the foregoing, in no event shall a Change in Control be deemed to have
occurred with respect to a Participant if the Participant is part of a &#147;group&#148;, within the
meaning of Section&nbsp;13(d)(3) of the Act, which consummates the Change in Control
transaction. In addition, for purposes of the definition of Change in Control, a person
engaged in business as an underwriter of securities shall not be deemed to be the
beneficial owner of, or to beneficially own, any securities acquired through such person&#146;s
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->12<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">participation in good faith in a firm commitment underwriting until the expiration of forty
days after the date of such acquisition.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(f) <B>&#147;Change in Control Date&#148; </B>means the date on which a Change in Control occurs.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">(g) &#147;<B>Good Reason</B>&#148; means any of the following that occurs without a Participant&#146;s express
written consent:
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(i)&nbsp;in the case of any Participant, a material diminution or other reduction of
such Participant&#146;s authorities, duties or responsibilities, other than an
inadvertent act that is promptly remedied by Delta after written notice by such
Participant to the Chief Executive Officer of the Company;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(ii)&nbsp;the Participant&#146;s office is relocated by more than 50 miles;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(iii)&nbsp;a material reduction of Participant&#146;s Base Salary or incentive compensation
opportunities, in either case other than pursuant to a uniform percentage salary
reduction for all full-time domestic employees not subject to a collective
bargaining agreement;
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(iv)&nbsp;the Company does not keep in effect compensation, retirement, health and
welfare benefits, or perquisite programs under which the Participant receives
benefits substantially similar, in the aggregate, to those in effect prior to a
reduction (other than a reduction pursuant to an equivalent reduction in such
benefits for all full-time domestic employees who are not subject to a collective
bargaining agreement); or
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 4%">(v)&nbsp;a material breach by Delta of any binding obligation to the Participant
relating to a material term of the Participant&#146;s employment, including, but not
limited to, indemnification or the terms of an award under the Delta Air Lines,
Inc. 2007 Performance Compensation Plan, or any failure of a successor to the
Company to assume and agree to perform such obligation.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">Notwithstanding the foregoing:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;(i)&nbsp;any award made to a Participant under the Delta Air Lines, Inc. Merger Award
Program, (ii)&nbsp;any other equity-based awards or other incentive compensation awards made to
a Participant by any of Delta (or any Affiliate) or Northwest Airlines Corporation (or any
subsidiary) either on or before January&nbsp;1, 2009, and (iii)&nbsp;any equity-based awards, incentive compensation, retention payment, special
travel or other benefits provided to a Participant solely as a result of his or her initial
employment with Delta or any Affiliate, will be ignored for purposes of determining whether
a Participant has suffered a reduction that constitutes Good Reason;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B)&nbsp;with respect to any Participant who was employed by Northwest Airlines Corporation
or any subsidiary thereof immediately prior to October&nbsp;29, 2008, all compensation and
benefit programs provided to such Participant prior to that date by Northwest or any
subsidiary thereof, including, without limitation, the Participant&#146;s base salary, will be
ignored for purposes of determining whether a Participant has suffered a
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->13<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">reduction that constitutes Good Reason;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(C)&nbsp;as to any Participant, an event described above shall constitute Good Reason only
if such Participant gives the Company written notice of intent to resign and the facts that
constitute Good Reason within ninety (90)&nbsp;days of the occurrence of such event;
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(D)&nbsp;no event described above which is curable shall constitute Good Reason if such
event is cured by the Company or an Affiliate within thirty-one (31)&nbsp;days of the
Participant&#146;s notice, given in accordance with (C)&nbsp;above; and
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(E)&nbsp;absent a cure by the Company or an Affiliate as described in (D)&nbsp;above, the
Participant must separate from service prior to the end of the 180&nbsp;day period beginning
with the event that constituted Good Reason.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">(h)&nbsp;&#147;<B>MIP Target Amount</B>&#148; means as to any Participant, such Participant&#146;s target award amount
under the Company&#146;s Management Incentive Plan (or any similar plan) in effect at the time
such Participant has a termination of employment that entitles the Participant to benefits
hereunder (except as provided in Section&nbsp;4(a)).
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">(ij)&nbsp;<B>&#147;Revocation Period&#148; </B>means the period of time immediately following the date a
Participant signs an Agreement that he has to revoke such Agreement, with such period of
time specified in the Agreement.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">(j)&nbsp;&#147;<B>Voting Stock</B>&#148; means securities entitled to vote generally on the election of members
of the board of directors.
</DIV>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->14<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>



</BODY>
</HTML>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

<DIV align="right" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt"><B>Exhibit&nbsp;10.11(b)</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt"><B>AMENDMENT TO THE DELTA AIR LINES, INC.</B><BR>
<U><B>OFFICER AND DIRECTOR SEVERANCE PLAN</B></U><BR>
<B>As Amended and Restated as of January&nbsp;2, 2009<BR>
As Further Amended October&nbsp;20, 2009</B>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The Delta Air Lines, Inc. Officer and Director Severance Plan, as amended and restated as of
January&nbsp;2, 2009, and as further amended October&nbsp;20, 2009 (the &#147;<B>Plan</B>&#148;) is hereby amended as follows:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">1. Section 11(g) of the Plan (definition of &#147;Good Reason&#148;) is amended by deleting subsection (A)
thereof in its entirety and inserting the following new subsection (A) (as marked) in its place:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="2%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>&#147;(A) (i)&nbsp;any long-term award made to a Participant under the Delta Air Lines, Inc. 2007
Performance Compensation Plan, (ii)&nbsp;any other equity-based awards or other incentive
compensation awards made to a Participant by any of Delta (or any Affiliate) or Northwest
Airlines Corporation (or any subsidiary) either on or before January&nbsp;1, 2009, (iii)&nbsp;any
